stem: When a patient grips a pen, the index finger remains extended at the interphalangeal joints while the middle finger flexes normally. Tinel sign at the wrist is positive. Which muscle is weak due to this neuropathy?
rationale_correct: Carpal tunnel syndrome impairs the median-innervated first lumbrical, reducing flexion of the index finger at the MCP with IP extension control during pinch.

rationale_distractors.B: The fourth lumbrical is ulnar innervated and controls the ring finger.
rationale_distractors.C: Interossei are ulnar innervated and primarily abduct/adduct digits.
rationale_distractors.D: FDP to digit 4 is ulnar innervated distal to the wrist.
rationale_distractors.E: Extensor indicis is radial innervated and would cause extension weakness, not flexion collapse.
